page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Stallingborough is a village situated on heavy land some six miles north of Grimsby and three miles south of Immingham. The parish stretches north-east to the Humber Bank, but the village itself is built along the one road, with two main clusters of houses those in Church Lane and on a small new estate - Leggott Way. It is now mainly a dormitory village, with most of the workers travelling out to Immingham or Grimsby. The farmland which is mostly to the east of our area is worked by two farmers. The village is served by two shops, and hourly bus and train services are available to Grimsby, the trains also connecting with buses over the Humber Bridge to Hull. There is a junior school, a parish church, a Methodist Chapel and a public house.
